title: SBA Approval Predicate
description: Records human or organizational approval decisions for skill bundles. This predicate enables multi-party approval workflows, enterprise policy gates, and registry acceptance decisions.

name.description: The skill name as declared in SKILL.md.

bundle.description: References the exact bundle being approved.

digest.description: The sba-directory-v1 digest of the bundle being approved.

contentAttestationDigest.description: Optional SHA-256 of the sba-content-v1 Statement that this approval references.

auditAttestationDigest.description: Optional SHA-256 of the sba-audit-v1 Statement that informed this approval.

decision.description: The approval decision. APPROVED = unconditionally approved, REJECTED = denied, CONDITIONAL = approved with restrictions, REVOKED = previously approved but now withdrawn.

timestamp.description: ISO 8601 timestamp when the decision was made.

scope.description: The scope of this approval. GLOBAL = approved everywhere, ORGANIZATION = approved within an org, TEAM = approved for specific team, PROJECT = approved for specific project, REGISTRY = approved for public registry listing.

expiresAt.description: When this approval expires, if time-limited.

identity.description: Identifier for the approver (email, system ID, committee name).

role.description: Role or title of the approver.

reviewedArtifacts.description: List of attestations or artifacts reviewed before making this decision.

digest.description: SHA-256 digest of the reviewed artifact.

note.description: Optional note about what was observed in this artifact.

supersedes.description: If this approval supersedes a previous one, reference it here.

previousApprovalDigest.description: SHA-256 of the previous sba-approval-v1 Statement being superseded.

reason.description: Why the previous approval is being superseded.

workflowId.description: Identifier for the approval workflow instance.

ticketUrl.description: URL to the approval request ticket.

policyVersion.description: Version of the approval policy applied.
